intro: Neorosea trilocularis, commonly known as the three-chambered rose, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive three-chambered seed pods. The plant produces showy, pinkish-white flowers with five petals, typically blooming in late spring. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its unique appearance. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Neorosea trilocularis is considered a rare and endangered species.
